page.title: 06COMMUNITY ACTIVITIES-KENTON.
page.content: The{Community Tutor at Kenton School enquires into the leisure requirements of the local community and a move has been made to open the school and it's facilities to various{organised {activities.}The programme allows local people of all ages to get together to enjoy themselves,to try something new and to learn new skills,all organised by local residents.{Activities for {children}range from gymnastics to computing, crafts and rock climbing. {Adults}are catered for by activities such as typing,flower arranging and women's self-defence.Pupils also help with{a luncheon club for the elderly. Attatched to the school is a{Youth and {Community Centre}which organises youth clubs, women's groups and a 'drop-in' facility for the unemployed. All activities cost between 20p-50p a session,which most people can afford.
